title: James Argent ‘embarrassed’ after Gemma Collins calls police over 'concerns'
text:
Gemma was concerned for her ex-boyfriend’s wellbeing (Picture: WireImage)

James Argent admits he’s been left ‘embarrassed’ after his on-off girlfriend, Gemma Collins, reportedly called the police with concerns over his welfare.

The former Towie star sparked worry among his friends and family when he failed to answer messages on Thursday.

According to the Sun on Sunday, it prompted Gemma, 38, to contact the emergency services who then visited the reality star’s home in South Woodford, north London to check he was well.

Explaining the situation, Arg told the publication: ‘I wasn’t speaking to a certain person so I didn’t reply.

‘They became concerned and called the police and ambulance. They turned up and checked on me. They came up to my room to make sure I was fine.’

Arg, 31, says his parents were already in the house checking up on him when ‘this person’ called the emergency services again. An ambulance then turned up to his house at around 4pm and they had a ‘quick chat on the doorstep’ with Arg, who has just moved into the property.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I wasn’t speaking to this person for a reason and they were worried about my safety because I wasn’t answering the phone,’ the TV star explained.

Arg admits he’s ‘slightly embarrassed’ by the situation (Picture: ITV, Rex Features)

‘I was perfectly fine, we all had a chat and carried on the day with my parents, we were just hanging up pictures.

‘The police and paramedics were only here for about 10 minutes. I’m slightly embarrassed really. I apologise for any wasted police time as I was absolutely fine,’ he added.

London Ambulance Service confirmed they responded to a call at around 12:55pm about an ‘unwell’ person.

‘We sent an ambulance crew and incident response officer and treated a person at the scene,’ they said.

The Metropolitan Police added: ‘Police were called at 13.11hrs to a residential address following concerns for the welfare of male occupant. Officers attended with LAS. The male, in his 30s, was spoken to. He was left in the company of family.

‘Officers were called at 16.21hrs to the same address, again due to concerns for the same male’s welfare. The male declined assistance.’

Metro.co.uk has reached out to James and Gemma’s reps for comment.

description: Gemma Collins reportedly called the police to check on her ex-boyfriend James Argent with concerns over his welfare.
